website_summaries.verdict: The A10-7800, AMD's latest CPU/GPU, can't be overclocked, but paired with fast RAM, it can handle 1080p gaming quite well, and it can run in a lower-power mode without a huge hit to performance.
pros: Integrated graphics can handle most games at 1080p and midrange settings
Compatible with existing FM2+ socket motherboards
Can be configured to run at 45 or 65 watts
cons: CPU performance still lags behind that of the competition
Fast RAM required for best gaming performance
Heterogeneous System Architecture (HSA) support currently limited

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu + igpu combo on the budget
customer_reviews.text: I got this apu paired with two 4gb ram sticks to build my brother an affordable gaming pc. He plays Heroes of The Storm and World of Warcraft on his pc just fine at 1080p, 50fps, and high graphic settings. I'm glad the integrated gpu performs pretty well on my brother's games, which saved him money from having to buy a dedicated gpu. For moderately demanding games the A10 7800 is not bad at all!
customer_reviews.author: ShyBoo81

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: Not built for bleeding edge gaming, but that's not why I bought this. Am using as part of a cycling training setup. Wanted something that didn't require the cost of a dedicated graphics card. Final box (built with PCPartsPicker help) integrates well with Wahoo Kickr and handles TrainerRoad + Spotify. Handles Zwift beta without difficulty. I also stream high-def movies from my NAS without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great for thrifty/casual gaming rigs.
customer_reviews.text: Great combination for a mid-level gaming rig on the cheap. Was able to re-build my computer for under 500 bucks and this was a key factor. Recommended for thrifty/casual gamers.
customer_reviews.author: dcheeseman

customer_reviews.title: HSA support
customer_reviews.text: A very well balanced CPU, and the first series of chips from AMD that should fully support HSA.
customer_reviews.author: Abracadabra

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a low powered PC, I was just going to use it to watch some TV and browse the web but I've found the APU is more than capable enough to even run some lite games. I've been using it more than my "gaming" PC even. I have noticed it getting a bit warm but that's because I'm using it in a open air chassis but it hasn't crashed from heat. I'm very impressed and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it long but works well with games nice and quiet seems fast.
customer_reviews.author: frank j barone

customer_reviews.title: New Box
customer_reviews.text: I used this processor in a new build in a SSF case. I have Windows Technical Preview (win10) installed so it is difficult to evaluate the system. The system is absolutely quite which I love (Noctua cooler and case fans). Build went without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: John Detuerk

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Impressive little motherboard. I paired it with an MSI A88XI motherboard to use as a 4k HTPC... turned out I can play CoD MW3 at max resolution on my 63" TV. It is very snappy and fast. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: alaboos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best value! I got this for a cheaper price than a lower end version.
customer_reviews.author: Will Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed overall because in order to have it hooked up ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the MSI Computer Corp. Micro ATX DDR3 2400 Motherboards A88XM GAMING. I was disappointed overall because in order to have it hooked up to a decent size tv as a media computer and to be able to play decent looking 1080p movies and shows, I have to add an additional video card. I thought the whole point of the FM series chips and boards were that you didn't have to add a video card because there are 8 cores just for the GPU. If I had known how this was going to go, I would have just gone with an FX series board and CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Love AMD CPUs
customer_reviews.text: I have been building my own PCs since Windows 98 and I have been using AMD CPUs exclusively. They whoop the pants off of Intel both in performance and price. Why in the world ANYONE would want to buy anything else is beyond me. Save yourself some money and get the best CPU for your PC - absolutely the best. AMD baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: AMD...Enough Said!
customer_reviews.text: Having been an Intel user for more years than necessary, I switched to AMD while building my Present unit. I was so amazed with the results, I now have two (2) laptops (A series). Works when I ask with no questions, gets the job done efficiently, fast with no problems what so ever. Love my AMD!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gaming without costing an Arm and Leg
customer_reviews.text: Before shopping my brother and I discussed our criteria for buying a processor. We decided to go quadcore and we ended up with reviews of amd apu to which were impressed with the benchmark and the cost of the product. We are also amazed at the tpd of only 65w the cpu and onboard graphics it will be running on. Truly this product is recommended for its low cost, low energy requirement and great gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ericson R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product with excellent performance.
customer_reviews.text: I am a loyal AMD fan and this product is the best of class in a desktop processor. My wife uses it for all her gaming with a 27" HD monitor and multitask games and Photoshop with no issues. Great processor for the money. I set her machine up and don't even have to think about any problems she might encounter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great products at a price that is affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I built a PC for my family to use and using the A10-7800 in it makes it run flawlessly! There isn't any problem running any of the newest games on it. Being able to connect to multiple monitors is a huge plus for me. You can't beat AMD for their build quality and pricing in my opinion! If you're looking for a very good APU for your next build then you can't go wrong with the A10-7800, just buy it and finish your build so you can see for yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speedy Gonzales would have been proud.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well under many load characteristics. The only time my laptop slows down is because of memory starvation. This processor eats through my day to day work and gaming interests well.
customer_reviews.author: Cigar Smoke

customer_reviews.title: HTPC on a chip!
customer_reviews.text: This processor has more than enough power to run a Home Theater PC (HTPC) with room to spare - even if you turn up the post processing on the graphics. You can even game on it, giving you gaming on your main TV. What is there not to love!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Performance & reliability
customer_reviews.text: My A10 is actually an A10 6800. The only problem I had was with the kit. The CPU cooler fan included is weak and won't allow turbo mode to be used without an overheat problem. I have since upgraded to a larger cooling unit and solved the problem. The performance is quite good for everyday use. I would recommend the A10 for most uses but I don't know how well it would work with graphic intensive programs.
customer_reviews.author: mikeeej

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance From An All In One Chip!
customer_reviews.text: This chip combines a fast CPU with a Passmark score of 5467 with a powerful GPU that gets 115 fps in the HL2 Lost Coast benchmark to create a product that offers great performance for the price. My only gripe is that AMD does need to patch its Ubuntu Catalyst driver for the A10 7800 because while my laptop which runs an A8 6410 runs fine with Ubuntu my desktop with the A10 7800 and the same operating randomly freezes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: They work right from start to end.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has the 8 core I have the 6 core. After building pc's (privately - not professionally) the one thing that has always been common is that AMD's work. They just work. I cannot name how many times I made loud expletives at building pc's with other processors. My entire family can vouch for that. Where as AMD - all they hear from me is things like "Sweet" or "Beautiful".
customer_reviews.author: Aedilwyn

customer_reviews.title: I have the exact same chip and it runs pretty good its not for gaming ish but it will ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the exact same chip and it runs pretty good its not for gaming ish but it will play it by 30 fps and i use 12gb ram ddr3
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMD ROCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first amd processes back in the 90's and it lasted almost 15 years why not stick with what works
customer_reviews.author: FAS Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Great for HTPC
customer_reviews.text: I bought the A10-7800 for a DIY computer as part of my living room entertainment system. With a BluRay drive, SSD drive, and a good internet connection, it has served to enhance the evening entertainment possibilities. I was very pleased with the responsiveness of the processor and its ability to provide high definition graphics. It simply works for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Lanny N. Little

customer_reviews.title: Great product, after 2 years it finally gave
customer_reviews.text: Great product, after 2 years it finally gave, and that is with heavy use of after effects and premier pro. Not the best for editing, but great for all-around use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My AMD Opinion
customer_reviews.text: I give two thumbs up to AMD for their product. I've played many present and older games on my pc and my AMD Radeon Graphics always does the job. Thanks, to the Team
customer_reviews.author: Paul K Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, solid performance, great price
customer_reviews.text: I have used AMD chips for years and the new APU offerings continue to keep me buying AMD products. You can not beat the "bang for the buck" performance and even with that in mind, it performs more than well enough for all of today's software and games.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Robin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Built my gaming machine using this processor & also have the Radeon R9 270x and pairing with both, my games run flawlessly! Nothing keeps me from doing what I'm doing on my computer with my AMD hardware. I will stick with AMD til the day I die
customer_reviews.author: Adam Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Incredible CPU
customer_reviews.text: This by far the best processor I've ever used. It plows thru most anything effortlessly
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  power at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Built a system with a FirePro for 3D CAD at home. WORKS GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Bill A.

customer_reviews.title: I am a fan and this is why
customer_reviews.text: I have used AMD products for about 10 years if not more than that now. the products have been very reliable as well as very well priced. I am a gamer so the multi core technology is critical to successful experiences in my opinion. I have priced and reviewed Intel products for associates of mine for their rigs and have found them lacking each and every time. I will not recommend or even build a computer for anyone with an Intel processor in it.
customer_reviews.author: Malavio

customer_reviews.title: A 10 6800
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Gaming is great. Running in crossfire configuration and it is quick.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lemaster

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: It works hard to make your work easy. Great for games and for work and the cost makes it easy on your wallet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun with AMD
customer_reviews.text: This processor was used in a custom case build. The requirements were: Low thermal dissipation, strong internal graphics, and low total power consumption. This APU met every requirement like a champ. I now have the only Atari 2600 on my block that can play Star Citizen on my big screen.
customer_reviews.author: Jim O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because i was upgrading my RAM and decided to up my processor while i was at it. Far surpassed what i expected
customer_reviews.author: Kami-sama

customer_reviews.title: I Love AMD
customer_reviews.text: I love AMD products because they are high-quality without Intel's high price.
customer_reviews.author: davebunch65

customer_reviews.title: Why I'm a fan of AMD products
customer_reviews.text: 4 Stars. AA very good APU for Home system Kit builders.
customer_reviews.author: ehsumrell1

customer_reviews.title: priced right and performance happy
customer_reviews.text: purchased with my Samsung laptop works as expected plus more
customer_reviews.author: kuya

customer_reviews.title: Why I bleed red
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely the s*** I have to laptops that run amd products and a desktop. I could never ask for better and I am always amazed at the power these chips can force out. I would always recommend red before blue or green. They are cheap and overly efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Newman

customer_reviews.title: AMD WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: My AMD processer works like a charm. I love how fast it is.I have 3 computers and that laptop is the only one with amd,wish my aio had this processer.My games work really well and plays my dvd's with great color and no noise
customer_reviews.author: mike brazier

product_meta.title: AMD AMD A10 7800 FM2+ Box R7 Series Graphics 3.9 4 Socket FM2+ AD7800YBJABOX
product_meta.description: AMD A10-7800 processor redefines the game for PCs by revolutionizing the accelerated desktop processor that combines the power of a multicore CPU with AMD Radeon graphics all in one energy-efficient chip. It is the first APU with H.S.A. (Hetrogenous Systems Architecture which defines how the 4 compute cores interact with the 8 graphics cores. This APU also is Mantle capable, improving it's console-like optimizations & Uses FM2+ socket.
feature_bullets: Experience a new level of immersion with AMD TrueAudio technology
Unlock your system's full potential with HSA-enabled APUs
12 Compute Cores - 4 CPU Cores + 8 Graphics Cores
Blaze through apps with AMD Turbo Core technology

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars106 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
